title: Password Cracking - Weak Password Used to Secure ████ Containing a Plaintext Password
content:
Summary:
I was able to crack the password to the ████████ located at ██████, as the pdf was protected with a weak password contained in a common word list. This guide contains steps to set-up the ███████ secure communication application with the unprotected configuration file located at██████████. This guide also contains a plaintext password for the configuration file.
Step-by-step Reproduction Instructions
Browse to ███
Click ████████. You will be prompted for a password.
Using wget, download the pdf: wget ████████.
Once downloaded, you can use pdf2john to convert the pdf password into a format that is parse-able by john: perl /path/to/john/pdf2john.pl █████████.pdf
This will produce a hash. Cracking this hash with john and the rockyou wordlist will produce the password:
Code 532 Bytes
1root@kali:/home/kali# john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash.txt 
2Using default input encoding: UTF-8
3Loaded 1 password hash (PDF [MD5 SHA2 RC4/AES 32/64])
4Cost 1 (revision) is 6 for all loaded hashes
5Will run 4 OpenMP threads
6Press 'q' or Ctrl-C to abort, almost any other key for status
7█████████           (████████.pdf)
81g 0:00:00:00 DONE (2020-09-18 01:08) 1.785g/s 2285p/s 2285c/s 2285C/s 753951..poohbear1
9Use the "--show --format=PDF" options to display all of the cracked passwords reliably
10Session completed
You can now browse to █████████, click ███, and type in the password █████████ to view the pdf (or view it on your local system).
Reading the setup instructions, and attacker can download the Messaging Configto download the ████ configuration file. This mobile guide contains the plaintext password for the configuration file (███████). They can then attempt to use the configuration file and a compromised .mil/.gov/etc. account to gain access to ████ secure communications.
References
https://github.com/openwall/john/blob/bleeding-jumbo/run/pdf2john.pl
Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
Use a strong password for this .pdf file in order to prevent successful password cracking attempts.
Impact
This guide contains steps to set-up the ███████ secure communication application with the unprotected configuration file located at█████. This guide also contains a plaintext password for the configuration file. An attacker could potentially join the secure communication channel if they were able to obtain access to the DoD ID number of an ███ member.
weaknesses: Storing Passwords in a Recoverable Format
steps: Browse to the target URL and attempt to access the protected PDF.
Use wget to download the PDF file.
Convert the PDF password hash using pdf2john.pl.
Crack the hash using John the Ripper with the rockyou.txt wordlist.
Use the cracked password to access the PDF and extract the plaintext configuration password.
Use the extracted password to access the secure communication configuration file.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves cracking a weakly protected PDF password using a common wordlist, which then reveals a plaintext password for a secure communication configuration file. This allows unauthorized access to secure communications if combined with a compromised .mil/.gov account.
reason: The attack is straightforward and relies on common tools and techniques (password cracking with John the Ripper and a known wordlist). There are no complex interactions or novel logic involved; the vulnerability stems from weak password practices.
